UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: The C-terminal sequences of porcine thrombin are active as antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: Lv X, Ma Q, Zhu D, Shao C, Lv Y, Shan A

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=>128µM),Bacillus subtilis CMCC 63501(MIC=>128µM),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC=>128µM),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=>128µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium C77-31(MIC=>128µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Pullorum C79-13(MIC=>128µM),Escherichia coli UB1005(MIC=64µM)
